baseline_groups.claim_summary: EE reallocation rate positively predicts composition-adjusted nominal earnings growth at the market level, conditional on other labor market flows and time trend. Two-stage WLS with market FE, SIPP 1996-2013.
baseline_groups.notes: 5 baseline flow specs (ee_only, ee_ue, ee_ue_ur, all_flows, grouped_flows) from Table 1. Primary is ee_only (Spec 1). Coefficients: ee_only=0.0450, ee_ue=0.0474, ee_ue_ur=0.0414, all_flows=0.0450, grouped_flows=0.0516

baseline_groups.claim_summary: EE reallocation rate positively predicts composition-adjusted real earnings growth at the market level, conditional on other labor market flows and time trend. Two-stage WLS with market FE, SIPP 1996-2013.
baseline_groups.notes: 5 baseline flow specs (ee_only, ee_ue, ee_ue_ur, all_flows, grouped_flows) from Table 1. Primary is ee_only (Spec 1). Coefficients: ee_only=0.0373, ee_ue=0.0386, ee_ue_ur=0.0354, all_flows=0.0387, grouped_flows=0.0448

baseline_groups.claim_summary: EE reallocation rate has a weak/null effect on composition-adjusted nominal hourly wage growth. Effect weakens with additional flow controls (Spec 6 = 0.0006, p=0.104). Two-stage WLS, hourly-worker subsample.
baseline_groups.notes: 5 baseline flow specs (ee_only, ee_ue, ee_ue_ur, all_flows, grouped_flows) from Table 1. Primary is ee_only (Spec 1). Coefficients: ee_only=0.0096, ee_ue=0.0040, ee_ue_ur=0.0016, all_flows=0.0006, grouped_flows=0.0018

baseline_groups.claim_summary: EE reallocation rate has null or negative effect on composition-adjusted real hourly wage growth. Sign reverses with full controls (Spec 6 = -0.0037). Two-stage WLS, hourly-worker subsample.
baseline_groups.notes: 5 baseline flow specs (ee_only, ee_ue, ee_ue_ur, all_flows, grouped_flows) from Table 1. Primary is ee_only (Spec 1). Coefficients: ee_only=0.0039, ee_ue=-0.0018, ee_ue_ur=-0.0024, all_flows=-0.0037, grouped_flows=-0.0026

global_notes: All 4 baseline groups from SPECIFICATION_SURFACE.json are present in the results and are coherent.
No spurious or missing baseline groups.
Treatment variable 'xee' is consistent across all 284 rows. No treatment drift.
No outcome drift: each group uses exactly one outcome variable throughout.
20 total baselines (5 per group), matching the surface plan exactly.
All baselines succeeded (0 failures). Coefficients match Table 1 values at reported precision.
G1/G2 (earnings) show robust positive EE effect. G3 (nominal hourly wage) shows weak effect. G4 (real hourly wage) shows sign reversal with controls. This matches the paper's central finding.
